title: Preparing Animal Meat in Radioactive Areas
brief: How to safely prepare and cook meat from animals in radioactive fallout areas.
steps: Step 1: Reject any animal that appears sick or diseased - it may have bacterial infection from radiation.
Step 2: Carefully skin the animal to prevent radioactive particles on fur from entering the body.
Step 3: Cut meat away from bones, leaving at least 3 millimeters of meat on the bone - discard the bone.
Step 4: Remove and discard all internal organs (heart, liver, kidneys) as they concentrate radiation.
Step 5: Cut meat into pieces less than 13 millimeters thick for thorough cooking.
Step 6: Cook meat until very well done to ensure all portions reach safe temperature.
warnings: Do not eat contaminated meat even if cooked - it can cause severe illness or death
Animal skeletons contain over 90% of radioactivity - never eat meat close to bones
Internal organs concentrate beta and gamma radiation - always discard them
